title: change of scenery powerful
description: monotony bad

title: understanding emotions
description: analyzing and feeling negative emotions give you positive ideas and emotions

title: give feedback to others (if they want it)
description: always voice feedback even if it is negative; dont be afraid of how they think about you; its so much worse if you keep it inside

title: honest feedback good
description: good way to improve: ask for honest feedback

title: normalize so quickly so insanely hard to see other perspectives clearly
description: maybe reflecting can help with this

title: different people different perspectives
description: wildly different perspectives, dont assume anything about them, often wrong

title: patterns
description: so many patterns and connections everywhere fun and give great understanding

title: independent thinking
description: have your own thoughts, dont be overwritten by other's ideas (push back + filter coef)

title: dont depend on validation
description: many times dependent on other's approval and opinion, especially if they are cracked, should not (should have learned from po-shen loh)

title: status nuanced—no binary
description: dont get fooled into "they are good" or "they are bad" there are always nuances; especially dont get fooled to thinking that way about yourself (+1)

title: tm—how learn better
description: whats really important to think about is how could i have learned better

title: be kind
description: "be kind, everyone is fighting"

title: attack discomfort
description: great example is spend 5m starting something i didnt really want to do, then immediately want to do it now (+ see the value of it), e.g. wmeetings

title: effort good
description: have infinite food and recovery methods (can reset when cooked) so give everything your all, and you will be chilling

title: corroboration
description: use corroboration to find truth in things that you cant experience and can only ask others about

title: vulnerability for connection
description: use vulnerability, honesty, transparency, openness for fasttrack to deep connection

title: art capturing experiences
description: poetry and writing and photography and music are all really nice ways to capture experiences, something that people dont usually do and is generally very hard (because diff perspectives insanely hard to comprehend for humans)

title: intentionality
description: be much more intentional and active with time in general (and specifically at orbit)

title: disjointed ideas not the best (80-15-5)
description: for the most connection max, go for stuff that are all clustered together, but defs work on other stuff to gain perspective (just dont explore in completely random directions)

title: understand focus/goal
description: for research: make sure to understand what exactly the focus is on

title: meditate to despeed
description: "should meditate for 15, and if you dont have time for it, you should meditate for 30"

title: checkins (2m)
description: periodic and for work

title: plan then lock
description: right before working, make plan for how to lock and then lock

title: sleep onset
description: PLS PLS PLS

title: think abt maybes
description: spend time thinking about "maybe"s, they are good for getting thoughts down but not good for reflection (like taking something murky and getting clarity)

title: spend money bias
description: many times spending money is overwhelmingly good but have bias to not (probably good investment to spend money to be able to not have to think about things)

title: do trials for products
description: is just very aligned with my incentive structure, good exploration, dont have to pay up front

title: maintainability; minimalism for projects
description: for success of project that will be very big, dont be lazy and just pile stuff on; actually understanding code base makes making changes much easier (keep everything simple, preferably under 200 lines)

title: understand opportunity cost
description: zoom out to things that we could / might should be doing was good, put more todo list items (make work more pressured and fast)

title: no more comas!!
description: food comas, cookie comas, yt comas, water comas, any over indulgence that creates listnessless / a unwillingness to do things; can just consume but stop before it is bad

title: dont over organize / document
description: only do stuff when i actually need it

title: add new action items to actions
description: so that i have to look at it, and see the other more important things

title: look back at old thoughts
description: looking back at old thoughts is always great (probably another way to reset)

title: bias towards past todo
description: many times have todos from previous days that i was excited about but when i actually do it later its not as fun (1. when i dont want to do something, consider why, maybe dont do it, 2. when really want to do something in the moment, dont relegate it to future self, just do it (the excitement often fades away))

title: maleability of current task/event
description: an important part of instantaneous intentionality is that not only are we maximizing the thing were doing in the moment, we should also consider changing the situation you are in to be doing something else (decision making blunder to not consider not going on the retreat until i heard that lucile wasnt going)
